15/*! \file
16 * Heap implementation of priority queues adapted from the following:
17 *
18 * \li "Introduction to Algorithms," Cormen, Leiserson, and Rivest,
19 * MIT Press / McGraw Hill, 1990, ISBN 0-262-03141-8, chapter 7.
20 *
21 * \li "Algorithms," Second Edition, Sedgewick, Addison-Wesley, 1988,
22 * ISBN 0-201-06673-4, chapter 11.
23 */
24
25#include <config.h>
26
27#include <stdbool.h>
28
29#include <isc/heap.h>
30#include <isc/magic.h>
31#include <isc/mem.h>
32#include <isc/string.h> /* Required for memmove. */
33#include <isc/util.h>
34
35/*@{*/
36/*%
37 * Note: to make heap_parent and heap_left easy to compute, the first
38 * element of the heap array is not used; i.e. heap subscripts are 1-based,
39 * not 0-based. The parent is index/2, and the left-child is index*2.
40 * The right child is index*2+1.
41 */
42#define heap_parent(i) ((i) >> 1)
43#define heap_left(i) ((i) << 1)
44/*@}*/
45
46#define SIZE_INCREMENT 1024
47
48#define HEAP_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('H', 'E', 'A', 'P')
49#define VALID_HEAP(h) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(h, HEAP_MAGIC)
50
51/*%
52 * When the heap is in a consistent state, the following invariant
53 * holds true: for every element i > 1, heap_parent(i) has a priority
54 * higher than or equal to that of i.
55 */
56#define HEAPCONDITION(i) ((i) == 1 || \
57 ! heap->compare(heap->array[(i)], \
58 heap->array[heap_parent(i)]))
59
60/*% ISC heap structure. */
61struct isc_heap {
62 unsigned int magic;
63 isc_mem_t * mctx;
64 unsigned int size;
65 unsigned int size_increment;
66 unsigned int last;
67 void **array;
68 isc_heapcompare_t compare;
69 isc_heapindex_t index;
70};
71
72#ifdef ISC_HEAP_CHECK
73static void
74heap_check(isc_heap_t *heap) {
75 unsigned int i;
76 for (i = 1; i <= heap->last; i++) {
77 INSIST(HEAPCONDITION(i));
78 }
79}
80#else
81#define heap_check(x) (void)0
82#endif
83
84isc_result_t
85isc_heap_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_heapcompare_t compare,
86 isc_heapindex_t idx, unsigned int size_increment,
87 isc_heap_t **heapp)
88{
89 isc_heap_t *heap;
90
91 REQUIRE(heapp != NULL && *heapp == NULL);
92 REQUIRE(compare != NULL);
93
94 heap = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*heap));
95 if (heap == NULL)
96 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
97 heap->magic = HEAP_MAGIC;
98 heap->size = 0;
99 heap->mctx = NULL;
100 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &heap->mctx);
101 if (size_increment == 0)
102 heap->size_increment = SIZE_INCREMENT;
103 else
104 heap->size_increment = size_increment;
105 heap->last = 0;
106 heap->array = NULL;
107 heap->compare = compare;
108 heap->index = idx;
109
110 *heapp = heap;
111
112 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
113}
114
115void
116isc_heap_destroy(isc_heap_t **heapp) {
117 isc_heap_t *heap;
118
119 REQUIRE(heapp != NULL);
120 heap = *heapp;
121 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
122
123 if (heap->array != NULL)
124 isc_mem_put(heap->mctx, heap->array,
125 heap->size * sizeof(void *));
126 heap->magic = 0;
127 isc_mem_putanddetach(&heap->mctx, heap, sizeof(*heap));
128
129 *heapp = NULL;
130}
131
132static bool
133resize(isc_heap_t *heap) {
134 void **new_array;
135 unsigned int new_size;
136
137 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
138
139 new_size = heap->size + heap->size_increment;
140 new_array = isc_mem_get(heap->mctx, new_size * sizeof(void *));
141 if (new_array == NULL)
142 return (false);
143 if (heap->array != NULL) {
144 memmove(new_array, heap->array, heap->size * sizeof(void *));
145 isc_mem_put(heap->mctx, heap->array,
146 heap->size * sizeof(void *));
147 }
148 heap->size = new_size;
149 heap->array = new_array;
150
151 return (true);
152}
153
154static void
155float_up(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int i, void *elt) {
156 unsigned int p;
157
158 for (p = heap_parent(i) ;
159 i > 1 && heap->compare(elt, heap->array[p]) ;
160 i = p, p = heap_parent(i)) {
161 heap->array[i] = heap->array[p];
162 if (heap->index != NULL)
163 (heap->index)(heap->array[i], i);
164 }
165 heap->array[i] = elt;
166 if (heap->index != NULL)
167 (heap->index)(heap->array[i], i);
168
169 INSIST(HEAPCONDITION(i));
170 heap_check(heap);
171}
172
173static void
174sink_down(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int i, void *elt) {
175 unsigned int j, size, half_size;
176 size = heap->last;
177 half_size = size / 2;
178 while (i <= half_size) {
179 /* Find the smallest of the (at most) two children. */
180 j = heap_left(i);
181 if (j < size && heap->compare(heap->array[j+1],
182 heap->array[j]))
183 j++;
184 if (heap->compare(elt, heap->array[j]))
185 break;
186 heap->array[i] = heap->array[j];
187 if (heap->index != NULL)
188 (heap->index)(heap->array[i], i);
189 i = j;
190 }
191 heap->array[i] = elt;
192 if (heap->index != NULL)
193 (heap->index)(heap->array[i], i);
194
195 INSIST(HEAPCONDITION(i));
196 heap_check(heap);
197}
198
199isc_result_t
200isc_heap_insert(isc_heap_t *heap, void *elt) {
201 unsigned int new_last;
202
203 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
204
205 heap_check(heap);
206 new_last = heap->last + 1;
207 RUNTIME_CHECK(new_last > 0); /* overflow check */
208 if (new_last >= heap->size && !resize(heap))
209 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
210 heap->last = new_last;
211
212 float_up(heap, new_last, elt);
213
214 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
215}
216
217void
218isc_heap_delete(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int idx) {
219 void *elt;
220 bool less;
221
222 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
223 REQUIRE(idx >= 1 && idx <= heap->last);
224
225 heap_check(heap);
226 if (heap->index != NULL)
227 (heap->index)(heap->array[idx], 0);
228 if (idx == heap->last) {
229 heap->array[heap->last] = NULL;
230 heap->last--;
231 heap_check(heap);
232 } else {
233 elt = heap->array[heap->last];
234 heap->array[heap->last] = NULL;
235 heap->last--;
236
237 less = heap->compare(elt, heap->array[idx]);
238 heap->array[idx] = elt;
239 if (less)
240 float_up(heap, idx, heap->array[idx]);
241 else
242 sink_down(heap, idx, heap->array[idx]);
243 }
244}
245
246void
247isc_heap_increased(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int idx) {
248 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
249 REQUIRE(idx >= 1 && idx <= heap->last);
250
251 float_up(heap, idx, heap->array[idx]);
252}
253
254void
255isc_heap_decreased(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int idx) {
256 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
257 REQUIRE(idx >= 1 && idx <= heap->last);
258
259 sink_down(heap, idx, heap->array[idx]);
260}
261
262void *
263isc_heap_element(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int idx) {
264 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
265 REQUIRE(idx >= 1);
266
267 heap_check(heap);
268 if (idx <= heap->last)
269 return (heap->array[idx]);
270 return (NULL);
271}
272
273void
274isc_heap_foreach(isc_heap_t *heap, isc_heapaction_t action, void *uap) {
275 unsigned int i;
276
277 REQUIRE(VALID_HEAP(heap));
278 REQUIRE(action != NULL);
279
280 for (i = 1 ; i <= heap->last ; i++)
281 (action)(heap->array[i], uap);
282}
